data.title: Rafael Nadal doesn't know if he'll be fit to face Nick Kyrgios in Wimbledon semifinals
data.description: Rafael Nadal says he doesn't know if he'll be fit enough to face Nick Kyrgios in their Wimbledon semifinal on Friday.

data.title: Coco Gauff suffers Wimbledon defeat against compatriot Amanda Anisimova
data.description: An emotional Amanda Anisimova got the better of her compatriot Coco Gauff to progress into the round of 16 at Wimbledon on Saturday.

data.title: US jobs growth slows in August
data.description: The US economy added 315,000 new jobs last month, far fewer than the number created in July

data.title: Nick Kyrgios says he feels 'composed' and 'mature' as he outlasts Brandon Nakashima to reach Wimbledon quarterfinals
data.description: Eight years on from his last quarterfinals appearance at Wimbledon, Nick Kyrgios says he feels "composed" and "mature" after reaching the same stage with a battling, five-set victory against Brandon Nakashima.

data.title: Serena and Venus Williams bounced from doubles' play at US Open
data.description: Serena Williams' illustrious doubles career has likely come to an end after she and her sister Venus fell in straight sets to the Czech duo of Linda Nosková and Lucie Hradecká in the first round of the US Open at Arthur Ashe Stadium.

data.title: Ons Jabeur aims to make more history at Wimbledon
data.description: Whenever Ons Jabeur steps onto a tennis court, she never plays solely for herself, but for the future generations she hopes to inspire.

data.title: Novak Djokovic cruises into Wimbledon fourth round with comfortable victory
data.description: Novak Djokovic produced another dominant performance to reach the Wimbledon fourth round after beating fellow Serb Miomir Kecmanović 6-0 6-3 6-4 on Friday.

data.title: Nick Kyrgios called 'evil' and a 'bully' by defeated Wimbledon opponent Stefanos Tsitsipas
data.description: Stefanos Tsitsipas said Nick Kyrgios has an "evil side" to his character after losing to the Australian in a feisty match at Wimbledon on Saturday.

data.title: Carlos Alcaraz reaches US Open quarterfinal with late-night win against Marin Cilic
data.description: The US Open men's draw is guaranteed to have a first-time grand slam champion after Marin Cilic, the 2014 champion in New York, was beaten in five sets by Carlos Alcaraz.

data.title: Rafael Nadal loses against Borna Ćorić in Cincinnati on return from injury
data.description: Rafael Nadal said it was "difficult to take a lot of positives" as his return from injury ended in a second-round defeat at the Western & Southern Open in Cincinnati.

data.title: 'I've dumbfounded all of you': Nick Kyrgios savors immaculate Wimbledon performance against Filip Krajinovic
data.description: Nick Kyrgios thought his first-round match was one of the worst he's ever played at Wimbledon; his performance against Filip Krajinovic two days later, however, may have been his best.

data.title: American Frances Tiafoe upsets Rafael Nadal in 4th round of US Open
data.description: Twenty-two-time grand slam champion Rafael Nadal was upset in the fourth round of the US Open on Monday by American Frances Tiafoe at Arthur Ashe Stadium in Flushing, New York.

data.title: Booker Prize: Alan Garner is oldest writer to make the shortlist
data.description: Six books make the cut for the coveted prize, including the shortest book to ever be recognised.

data.title: Venus Williams bows out in first round of women's singles at US Open
data.description: A day after her sister Serena advanced to the second round of the singles play at US Open tennis tournament, Venus Williams was not as fortunate, losing in straight sets to Alison Van Uytvanck of Belgium.

data.title: Fan takes legal action against Nick Kyrgios after allegation that she was 'drunk out of her mind' at Wimbledon final
data.description: The woman who​m Nick Kyrgios accused of having had "700 drinks" and being "drunk out of her mind" during this year's Wimbledon final in early July says she is suing the Australian tennis player for defamation.

data.title: The numbers that made Serena Williams a global superstar
data.description: The numbers that made Serena Williams a global superstar

data.title: Ons Jabeur makes grand slam history as she reaches Wimbledon semifinals
data.description: Ons Jabeur made history on the grass courts of Wimbledon Tuesday as she became the first Arab or North African woman to reach the semifinals of a grand slam.

data.title: How Frances Tiafoe went from sleeping at a tennis center to the US Open quarterfinals
data.description: Expectations of US tennis player Frances Tiafoe have been high for a long time and the world No. 26 is now looking more than comfortable on the sport's biggest stage.

data.title: Rafael Nadal loses against Borna Ćorić in Cincinnati on return from injury
data.description: Rafael Nadal said it was "difficult to take a lot of positives" as his return from injury ended in a second-round defeat at the Western & Southern Open in Cincinnati.

data.title: Serena Williams announces she will 'evolve away from tennis' after upcoming US Open
data.description: Serena Williams has announced that she will "evolve away from tennis" after this year's US Open to focus on "other things that are important to me."

data.title: Justin Bieber suspends tour to take care of his health
data.description: Justin Bieber announced Tuesday that he needs to take another break from touring in the wake of a health crisis he suffered earlier this year.

data.title: Emma Raducanu and Naomi Osaka both lose in US Open first round
data.description: It was a night to forget for two of tennis' biggest names as Naomi Osaka and Emma Raducanu both crashed out of the US Open first round on Tuesday.

data.title: Top seed Daniil Medvedev beaten by Nick Kyrgios at US Open
data.description: Defending champion Daniil Medvedev was knocked out of the US Open after losing 6-7 6-3 3-6 2-6 against Nick Kyrgios in the fourth round.

data.title: Belarusian tennis star Victoria Azarenka forced to withdraw from Toronto tournament due to visa issue
data.description: Belarusian tennis star Victoria Azarenka has been forced to withdraw from the National Bank Open in Toronto after her visa application to enter Canada was rejected, she wrote on Twitter.

data.title: Rafael Nadal drops first set but rallies to defeat Rinky Hijikata at US Open
data.description: Rafael Nadal dropped his opening set at the US Open but recovered to defeat Australian wildcard Rinky Hijikata 4-6 6-2 6-3 6-3.
